Real Estate Metrics That Drive Performance

Track comprehensive KPIs to boost every aspect of your brokerage

Listing Activity

  • New listings secured
  • Active listing inventory
  • Listing presentations
  • Price reductions managed

Sales Performance

  • Properties sold
  • Total sales volume
  • Average days on market
  • List-to-sale price ratio

Client Engagement

  • Buyer consultations
  • Property showings
  • Open house attendance
  • Client satisfaction scores

Business Development

  • Referrals generated
  • Repeat clients
  • Social media engagement
  • Community events hosted

How to Implement Real Estate Leaderboards

Get your brokerage up and running with gamification in just a few steps

1

Define Your Goals

Identify which metrics matter most - listings, sales volume, or client satisfaction?

2

Set Up Categories

Create leaderboards for different property types, price ranges, or geographic areas.

3

Launch & Communicate

Introduce the system at your next team meeting. Make it visible and celebrated.

4

Reward & Recognize

Tie leaderboard performance to rewards - bonuses, prime leads, or public recognition.

Real Estate Leaderboard Best Practices

Proven strategies from successful brokerages

‚úÖ Mix Activity and Results

Balance outcome metrics (sales) with activity metrics (showings, calls) to encourage consistent effort.

‚úÖ Create Multiple Winners

Have categories for luxury homes, first-time buyers, rentals, and commercial to give everyone a chance.

‚úÖ Display Prominently

Put leaderboards on office TVs, in break rooms, and send weekly email updates to maintain visibility.

‚ö†Ô∏è Avoid Only Tracking Sales

Focusing solely on closed deals can demotivate newer agents. Include effort-based metrics too.
